verses.text: For Zion’s sake will I not hold my peace, And for Jerusalem’s sake I will not rest, Until the righteousness thereof go forth as brightness, And the salvation thereof as a lamp \add that\add* burneth.
And the Gentiles shall see thy righteousness, And all kings thy glory: And thou shalt be called by a new name, Which the mouth of the \sc Lord\sc* shall name.
Thou shalt also be a crown of glory in the hand of the \sc Lord\sc*, And a royal diadem in the hand of thy God.

Thou shalt no more be termed Forsaken; Neither shall thy land any more be termed Desolate: But thou shalt be called Hephzi-bah, And thy land Beulah: For the \sc Lord\sc* delighteth in thee, And thy land shall be married.
For \add as\add* a young man marrieth a virgin, \add So\add* shall thy sons marry thee: And \add as\add* the bridegroom rejoiceth over the bride, \add So\add* shall thy God rejoice over thee.
I have set watchmen upon thy walls, O Jerusalem, \add Which\add* shall never hold their peace day nor night: Ye that make mention of the \sc Lord\sc*, Keep not silence,
and give him no rest, Till he establish, and till he make Jerusalem a praise in the earth.

The \sc Lord\sc* hath sworn by his right hand, and by the arm of his strength, Surely I will no more give thy corn \add to be\add* meat for thine enemies; And the sons of the stranger shall not drink thy wine, for the which thou hast laboured:
But they that have gathered it shall eat it, and praise the \sc Lord\sc*; And they that have brought it together shall drink it in the courts of my holiness.
Go through, go through the gates; prepare you the way of the people; Cast up, cast up the highway; gather out the stones; Lift up a standard for the people.
Behold, the \sc Lord\sc* hath proclaimed unto the end of the world, Say ye to the daughter of Zion, Behold, thy salvation cometh; Behold, his reward \add is\add* with him, And his work before him.
And they shall call them, The holy people, The redeemed of the \sc Lord\sc*: And thou shalt be called, Sought out, A city not forsaken.
